ari.ucidy

Class UCDWord

  • java.lang.Object
    • ari.ucidy.UCDWord

  • public class UCDWord
extends java.lang.Object
    Definition of a UCD word, according to the IVOA (v1.1 - 12 August 2005).

    See http://www.ivoa.net/documents/REC/UCD/UCD-20050812.html for more details.

    • Field Detail

      • NAMESPACE_SEP

        protected static final java.lang.String NAMESPACE_SEP
        Character used to separate the namespace prefix from a UCD word.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IVOA_NAMESPACE

        protected static final java.lang.String IVOA_NAMESPACE
        Default namespace: ivoa. When no namespace is specified, this is the one implied. However, it MUST be used only for words recommended by the IVOA.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REGEXP_UCD_ATOM

        public static final java.lang.String REGEXP_UCD_ATOM
        Regular Expression for a valid UCD's atom, according to the BNF provided in the IVOA Recommendation 2005-08-12 for UCD v1.1: http://www.ivoa.net/documents/REC/UCD/UCD-20050812.html

        Textually, this regular expression says that a UCD atom can contain ONLY (lower or upper case) letters, digits, hyphens and underscores, AND must NOT start with an hyphen or an underscore.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REGEXP_UCD_WORD

        public static final java.lang.String REGEXP_UCD_WORD
        Regular Expression for a valid UCD, according to the BNF provided in the IVOA Recommendation 2005-08-12 for UCD v1.1: http://www.ivoa.net/documents/REC/UCD/UCD-20050812.html

        Textually, this regular expression says that a UCD is a composition of a possible namespace and of at least one atom. All atoms MUST be separated by a period (.). The namespace syntax must be the same as an atom.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • syntaxCode

        public final UCDSyntax syntaxCode
        Rule about the syntax of the usage of this UCD word. (see UCDSyntax for more details)

        May be null. If so, this UCD word can NOT be recommended.

      • rawWord

        public final java.lang.String rawWord
        The UCD word as provided (may have a namespace prefix).

        Can NOT be null.

        See Also:
        namespace, word

      • namespace

        public final java.lang.String namespace
        The namespace of this UCD, as extracted from rawWord.

        This attribute is null if rawWord is not valid or does not have any namespace prefix.

      • word

        public final java.lang.String word
        The UCD word (without namespace prefix), as extracted from rawWord.

        This attribute is the resulting part of rawWord when its namespace prefix has been extracted (namespace). If rawWord is not valid or if no namespace is specified, this attribute will have exactly the same value as rawWord.

        Can NOT be null.

      • description

        public final java.lang.String description
        Human description of this UCD word.

        May be null.

      • valid

        public final boolean valid
        A UCD is valid if its syntax is correct.

        In other words:

        • if all atoms are composed of letters, digits, hyphens and/or underscores, BUT does not start with an hyphen or an underscore
        • atoms MUST be separated by '.'

        All these rules are expressed by a regular expression: REGEXP_UCD_WORD. So, this attribute will be true if it matches this regular expression.

        Note: This test is performed case INsensitively.

      • recognised

        public final boolean recognised
        A UCD word is recognised if among a list of well-known UCD words (not necessarily the ones provided by the IVOA).

        Important: A recognised UCD word MUST be valid AND its syntaxCode MUST be set.

      • recommended

        public final boolean recommended
        A UCD word is recommended if allowed by the IVOA, according to IVOA Recommendation 2018-05-27 for the UCD1+ controlled vocabulary v1.3: http://www.ivoa.net/documents/UCD1+/20180527/index.html

        Important 1: A recommended UCD MUST be recognised AND MUST have either no namespace or have the namespace "ivoa".

        Important 2: This test must have been performed case INsensitively.

      • closest

        public final UCDWord[] closest
        This attribute is set by UCDParser.parse(String) when a UCD word can not be recognised. Then the parse function tries to find the closest UCD words of its list of recognised words. If it finds any, it set this attribute with them using UCDWord(String, UCDWord[]).

        Important note: If this UCDWord is recognised, this attribute is null. If set, this array WILL always contain at least one item. Besides, if it is set the closest words specified here SHOULD always be recognised ; it is the responsibility of the provider of this array to ensure the "recognised" status of all given words.

      • suggestedReplacement

        public final UCD suggestedReplacement
        If this UCD word is deprecated, this property will be not null. Then, it will contain the suggested UCD to replace this deprecated UCD word by.

        May be null.

        Since:
        1.1
        See Also:
        isDeprecated()

    • Constructor Detail

      • UCDWord

        public UCDWord(UCDSyntax syntax,
               java.lang.String word,
               java.lang.String description,
               boolean recommended)
        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Create a recognised (under conditions, see below) UCD word.

        Conditions:

        • To be valid: the syntax of this UCD word MUST be correct. See valid for more details.
        • To be recognised: it MUST be valid AND the syntax code MUST be correct. See UCDSyntax for more details.
        • To be recommended: it MUST be recognised AND the parameter recommended MUST be set to true AND the namespace MUST be null or "ivoa".
        Parameters:
        syntax - Rule about the syntax when using this UCD word. (see UCDSyntax for more details)
        word - The UCD word, itself.
        description - Human description of this UCD word.
        recommended - true to consider this UCD word as recommended by the IVOA, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given word is null.

      • UCDWord

        public UCDWord(java.lang.String word)
        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Create a NON recommended and NON recognised UCD word.

        However, it may be flagged as valid if its structure is correct.

        Parameters:
        word - A UCD word.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given word is null or an empty string.

      • UCDWord

        protected UCDWord(java.lang.String word,
                  UCDWord[] closestMatches)
           throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Create a NON recommended and NON recognised UCD word.

        However, it may be flagged as valid if its structure is correct.

        IMPORTANT: The UCDWord provided in the given array - closestMatches - SHOULD contain ONLY recognised words. This fact won't be tested by this constructor.

        Parameters:
        word - A UCD word.
        closestMatches - Closest recognised matches found in the list of recognised words by the UCDParser.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given word is null or an empty string.

      • UCDWord

        protected UCDWord(java.lang.String word,
                  UCD suggestedReplacement,
                  UCDSyntax syntax,
                  java.lang.String description)
           throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a deprecated UCD word.

        It may be flagged as valid if its structure is correct but never as recognised or recommended.

        Parameters:
        word - The deprecated UCD word, itself. MANDATORY
        suggestedReplacement - The suggested UCD to replace the deprecated UCD word by. MANDATORY
        syntax - Rule about the syntax when using this UCD word. (see UCDSyntax for more details) OPTIONAL
        description - Human description of this UCD word. OPTIONAL
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given word is null or an empty string.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given suggested UCD is not fully valid and recognised.
        Since:
        1.1

    • Method Detail

      • isDeprecated

        public final boolean isDeprecated()
        Tell whether this UCD word is deprecated.

        If deprecated, the property suggestedReplacement will provide the UCD suggested by the IVOA to replace this deprecated UCD word by.

        Returns:
        true if deprecated, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.1
